alert.note: Alert for Matagorda; Wharton (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 25 at 7:46PM CST until January 28 at 6:30AM CST by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas... Trinity River near Goodrich affecting Liberty, San Jacinto and Polk Counties. Caney Creek near Splendora affecting Montgomery and Harris Counties. West Fork San Jacinto near Humble affecting Montgomery and Harris Counties. San Bernard River near Sweeny affecting Brazoria County. Colorado River at Wharton affecting Wharton and Matagorda Counties. Navidad River at Morales affecting Jackson and Lavaca Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... Bedias Creek near Madisonville affecting Walker and Madison Counties. East Fork San Jacinto near New Caney affecting Liberty, Montgomery and Harris Counties. Peach Creek at Splendora affecting Montgomery and Harris Counties. Lake Creek at Sendera Ranch Road affecting Montgomery County. West Fork San Jacinto near Porter affecting Montgomery County. San Jacinto River near Sheldon affecting Harris County. Tres Palacios River near Midfield affecting Wharton and Matagorda Counties. San Bernard River Near East Bernard affecting Fort Bend, Wharton, Austin and Colorado Counties. Colorado River at Columbus affecting Wharton and Colorado Counties. Navidad River near Speaks affecting Jackson and Lavaca Counties. Navidad River at Sublime affecting Lavaca County. Lavaca River near Edna affecting Jackson County. Trinity River near Moss Bluff affecting Liberty and Chambers Counties. Trinity River at Liberty affecting Liberty County. Trinity River at Riverside affecting San Jacinto, Walker, Trinity and Polk Counties. East Fork San Jacinto at Cleveland affecting Liberty, San Jacinto, Montgomery and Harris Counties. San Bernard River near Boling affecting Brazoria, Wharton and Fort Bend Counties. For the Trinity River...including Crockett, Riverside, Romayor, Goodrich, Liberty, Moss Bluff...Major flooding is forecast. For the Bedias Creek...including Madisonville...Minor flooding is forecast. For the East Fork San Jacinto River...including Cleveland, New Caney...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Peach Creek...including Splendora...Minor flooding is forecast. For the West Fork San Jacinto River...including Porter, Sendera Ranch Road, Conroe, Humble, Sheldon...Major flooding is forecast. For the San Bernard River...including East Bernard, Sweeny, Boling... Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Navidad River...including Sublime, Speaks, Morales, Strane Park...Major flooding is forecast. For the Lavaca River...including Komensky, Breslau, Hallettsville, Edna...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING TO SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Colorado River at Wharton. * WHEN...From Friday morning to Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 43.0 feet, Major lowland flooding begins in the vicinity of the gage as numerous streets in west and southwest Wharton are inundated and the lowest homes threatened. The JDIN Recreational Center in southwest Wharton close to being isolated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:15 PM CST Thursday the stage was 34.4 feet. - Bankfull stage is 20.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow morning to a crest of 42.9 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage Saturday evening. - Flood stage is 39.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 43.0 feet on 10/17/1957. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (8 pm CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Colorado River Wharton 39.0 34.4 Thu 7 pm CST 42.8 38.3 22.2 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Friday morning at 1145 AM CST.
